posts.post_content:
was looking forward to the Red Cobb

ugh is right

sold 4 cards to help fund ,mentioned that and the deal got canned.

still ugh !
So long story short, is the card sold??????

LET IT GO!!!  The seller has every right to back out of a deal if money has not be exchange.   

Move on!!

We talked abit on the phone and deal was done. he stated that he didnt care about T206's and 50 cards hi-end were the focus . He was working on a Aaron RC and was using the funds for the purchase. Then his deal supposedly fell through and I got an email the next day. "Iam not selling you the card . What I dont get it what does his deal have to do with my purchase , he still gains the 2k I agreed to purchase for and looks for another Aaron or doesnt...So that's the way it goes.:confused:

Oh well Joes vintage and Phillis plan (Doug) have me 2 decent bat off's to be proud of .GOnna get the Cobbs back going again and to be the main focus . Guess this Red wasnt meant to be :(

I made my point and using my freedom of speech .If you think not getting a card is going to change my life 1 iota WRONG. I had 44 Red Cobbs at once together and many other Cobbs overall. He used his rights and I used mine.

He still could have said dont sell your cards just yet to fund this.

 I still can replace all 4 portraits I sold that eve. I wasnt going to ask my guy for them back. That did change hands. But that big bordered Bender will take awhile to find back.:eek:
